club.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an organization for people who share a particular interest or enjoy similar activities, or a group of people who meet together to do something they are interested in
club.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: It costs £15 to join the club.
She belongs to a local health club.
Our chess club really needs new members.
a club for unemployed young people
club.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the building or place where the members of a particular club meet or play sport
club.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We could have dinner at the golf club.
club.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a professional organization including the players, managers, and owners of a sports team
club.translation[0].definitions[2].note_: In meanings 1 and 2, club is usually followed by a singular verb
The club meets on Mondays after school
The club meet on Mondays after school
club.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a place where people go to dance, listen to music, and meet socially
club.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Shall we go to a club?
I’m not into the club scene at all.
club.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: an organization, traditionally for men only, which provides a comfortable place for its members to relax, eat, or stay the night
club.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: I always stay at my London club.
club.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the building where this organization is based
club.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a long thin metal stick used in golf to hit the ball
club.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a thick heavy stick used to hit people
club.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: one of the four suits (=types of cards) in a set of playing cards, which has the design of three round black leaves in a group together
club.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: You have to play a club.
club.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: There’s a football club for the young people in the area.
Why don’t you join one of the school sports clubs?
The youth club is on Thursday nights in the village hall.
Older people may benefit from joining a social club.
The hotel has its own health club with saunas, solarium and work-out equipment.
I used to be a member of the Take That fan club.
Ted was a member of an exclusive country club.
I decided to join the computer club.
Do you belong to any university clubs or societies?
It’s always possible to form your own club.
My Dad helps to run the rowing club.
The chess club welcomes both beginners and experienced players.
a club member/member of a club
There’s a monthly magazine for club members.
Reg took over as club chairman three years ago,
For further information about membership, contact the club secretary.
At this meeting we will elect new club officials.
club.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to hit someone hard with a heavy object
club.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: baby seals being clubbed to death
